capabilities.label: Ethical Evaluation Capability
capabilities.definition: Ability to evaluate professional conduct against ethical codes and standards
capabilities.application_in_case: Evaluating Engineer A's AI use against NSPE Code
capabilities.source_text: The Board of Ethical Review (BER) has a long history of open and welcome advocacy

capabilities.label: Technology Adaptation
capabilities.definition: Ability of the engineering profession to incorporate new technologies while maintaining professional standards
capabilities.evidence: History of adopting CAD, CADD, and now AI tools
capabilities.application_in_case: Framework for evaluating ethical AI use
capabilities.source_text: BER has a long history of open and welcome advocacy for the introduction of new technologies

capabilities.label: Direction and Control Exercise
capabilities.definition: Ability to maintain supervisory authority over work products regardless of their origin
capabilities.source_text: the final document remained under Engineer A's direction and control

capabilities.label: AI Output Verification
capabilities.definition: Ability to verify, validate, and correct AI-generated content and designs
capabilities.application_in_case: Thorough for report, insufficient for designs
capabilities.source_text: Engineer A conducted a thorough review of the report

capabilities.label: Ethical Judgment Application
capabilities.definition: Ability to apply ethical principles to novel situations not explicitly covered by codes
capabilities.guidance: Ethical principles favor transparency for substantial AI contributions
capabilities.source_text: Ethical principles favor transparency when AI plays a substantial role in generating work products
